title: Thunderbird can receive, but not send emails
creator: flin_judy
content:
I cannot send emails and always get the same error message, no matter what steps I have taken. This has been the situation for nearly 48 hours. During this time I have undertaken the following steps, as advised by Thunderbird (TB)/ Optus and Google (not in order).

Checked SMTP server settings (many times), Re-booted the Router, Uninstalled and reinstalled TB, Changed the number of Server Connections to Cache from 5, down to 1 (as suggested by the TB Notification), Tried sending a test message to my other email address on several occasions, but got the same error message. I have checked my Webmail account and can send and receive from and to my email accounts from within webmail.

As required in the TB help file, The following information is provided: SMTP settings (attached). Mail Provider is Optusnet. ISP is Firefox. Antivirus is Trend Micro Maximum Security Version 17.9. OS (details attached).

If I have neglected any required info please ask. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you. Flin
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:145.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/145.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/cannot-send-messages"];solver_id:1915802

content: I wish to use Thunderbird email on my Android tablet and after installing the app on the android I followed the instructions on my desktop version. eg Settings, QR code etc and downloaded my accounts. My intention is to do away with my out of date PC and use an upmarket Android tablet.

title: Thunderbird won't check for new messages
creator: contact1220
content: Two nights ago I uninstalled ExpressVPN from my system at the instruction of one of their "support" people. My computer immediately lost the ability to access half of the websites I tried to visit and Thunderbird wouldn't send or receive email. I rebooted and that fixed every issue, but since then, Thunderbird no longer checks for new messages for any of my accounts. If I manually instruct it to check, it downloads the messages with no problem. I don't use any add-ons, and I'm using the latest version on a Windows 11 PC. I have already tried deleting global-messages-db.sqlite, repairing each mail folder from within Thunderbird, clearing the cache, and running an install of the latest version. I have also tried changing the setting for each mail folder to alter the interval for message checks by a minute just to see if that would jog it, but no luck. I've looked at various other help threads for this and am out of ideas. Thanks in advance for any help.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:145.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/145.0

title: Emails not in the right order in folders...
creator: sthoselitz
content: I have Thunderbird 145.0 (64-bit) running on an uptodate installation of Windows 11 and have recently found that the email in folders do not always order themselves in the way they are supposed to. Although I have all my folders set to show emails in date order, with the newest at the top I am now sometimes finding new emails halfway down the list. This has happened several times in the last few weeks. I have "repaired" the folders every time I notice this but it has not solved the problem. Is there a glitch in the later versions of Thunderbird which is causing this? It was apparent today with my 'deleted' folder. I can't send you an image because I have now sorted the issue, until it happens again. I only discovered this by mikssing a couple of important emails and finding them in webmail but not in Thunrderbird. I use IMAP and my settings to the server are correct.

title: Thunderbird forgets my settings
creator: rikardo.new
content:
My preferred settings for the message list pane (not sure if that's what everyone else calls it) include unthreaded, newest at top.

From time to time, Thunderbird apparently forgets these settings, and in all my mailboxes and sub-folders, lists messages with the newest at the bottom and threaded. I haven't checked how often this happens and it doesn't seem to be related to updates.

Any ideas about why T-bird does this, or even better, whether and how it can be fixed?

title: Thunderbird doesn't always download my emails
creator: mail2521
content: For the past month or so, Thunderbird has stopped providing me with emails as swiftly and reliably as it has been for many years. When starting the application; In the bottom of Thunderbird I can see it seems to do all the checks to the mailservers correctly, it just doesn't download any new emails. Nine out of ten times, it doesn't work. Then, all of sudden, once in a while, it actually does work. It's really irritating and I'm considering switching to another mail application. Currently, I can access my mail by logging on to the webmail, but it would be so much nicer if Thunderbird would work just as it is intended. Kind Regards from a user in Denmark, Scandinavia. Version: 140.5.0esr

title: Loss of Funtion After 20 Day Abscence
creator: bob.bench9
content: I am using Thunderbird 128.14.0esr on a Windows 10 system. There were no problems until my system was shut down for 20 days while I was in the hospital. After returning home Thunderbird had lost major parts of its functionality: Problem 1-Thunderbird was unable to download the approximate 2700 email messages that had accumulated while I was in the hospital. By experimenting with troubleshooting mode and various other things I eventually got these emails into my inbox. Problem 2-When I try to send or forward a message, after a long pause Thunderbird reports that the task failed because the connection to the outgoing mail server timed out. This happens even with a short simple message to myself. If I try to save the message to the Drafts folder that also fails with a timeout. Should I update to the 140.5.0esr release? Any other suggestions?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:145.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/145.0
